node.title: ‘More Democratic, and Less Toxic’: Turning a Troubled Theater Around
node.description: René Pollesch is the fourth boss of the Volksbühne in four years. The Berlin theater is pinning hopes of a return to its former vibrancy on his collaborative approach.

node.title: In Cyprus, Pope’s Plea for Migrants Clashes With Island’s Tensions
node.description: As he celebrated Mass, Pope Francis urged Cypriots to welcome refugees and embrace their home’s history as a crossroads of cultures. But the government says it is overwhelmed.

node.title: Dozens of Dogs Kept in 'Inhumane Conditions' Seized From Illegal Puppy Farm
node.description: "Most of the adult dogs were completely covered from head to toe in excrement," an animal welfare charity involved with the operation said.

node.title: Sylvester Stallone Excites QAnon by Wearing Q Hat, 'Into the Storm' Remark
node.description: The actor posted an image of himself on a plane with a caption believed to be a nod to the radical conspiracy.

node.title: Oakland Superintendent Said 'No Discipline Warranted' for Student Before Mass Shooting
node.description: "No discipline was warranted. There are no discipline records at the high school," said Oakland Community Schools' superintendent Tim Throne.

node.title: Sinema Cites Inflation, Corporate Taxes as Red Lines While Schumer Presses for BBB Vote
node.description: "I won't support any legislation that increases burdens on Arizona or American businesses," the Democratic senator said.

node.title: Watch Live: Charging decision expected for parents of school shooting suspect
node.description: Ethan Crumbley is the suspect in the Michigan high school shooting that left four students dead.

node.title: Nevada police ID teen found dead in 1980, vow to pursue her killer
node.description: Tammy Corrine Terrell was last seen in September 1980 with a man and a woman at a restaurant after a state fair in New Mexico.

node.title: Arca Once Made Electronic Music. Now She Builds Worlds.
node.description: The artist’s latest project is “KICK,” a five-album cycle accompanied by an elaborate 3-D visual world that presses against all kinds of boundaries.

node.title: Paul Verhoeven Has Made a Film About a Lesbian Nun. Jesus Is Next.
node.description: The Dutch filmmaker explains what his new movie, based on a real 17th-century sister, has in common with “Showgirls” and “Basic Instinct.”

node.title: Best Theater of 2021
node.description: Digital innovation continued this year, but experiencing plays in isolation grew tiring. Then came an in-person season as exciting as a child’s first fireworks.

node.title: ‘The Pressure of This Is a Privilege’
node.description: As Max Scherzer was introduced by the Mets as baseball’s highest-paid player, he praised a team owner who was willing to spend to make his team better.

node.title: New Zealand’s biggest city ends its 107-day lockdown.
node.description: Auckland entered severe restrictions in mid-August as it began fighting a Delta outbreak. Some bars reopened a minute before midnight, the moment they could.

node.title: Treasure Trove of Dinosaur Fossils Could Rewrite Prehistory
node.description: Among the remains of at least seven individuals from a species of Hadrosaur is an individual named Bruno, the most complete dinosaur skeleton found in Italy.

node.title: Hawaii Blizzard Warning Leaves Meteorologists Dumbfounded: 'Wow!'
node.description: Weather forecasters expect up to 12 inches of snowfall alongside wind gusts of over 100 mph.

node.title: Netflix announces movie about accidental Thanksgiving text
node.description: Dench accidentally invited Hinton to Thanksgiving in 2016, thinking she was texting her grandson. The pair have gotten together on Thanksgiving every year since.

node.title: A 73-Point Loser Is Not ‘Necessarily’ Who the Thunder Are
node.description: In a 152-79 loss, a rebuilding Oklahoma City team took record-setting lumps from the Memphis Grizzlies.

node.title: 6-Year-Old Boy, Caught in International Custody Battle, Is Expected to Return to Italy
node.description: Eitan Biran, who lost his parents in a cable car crash in Italy this year, had been taken to Israel by his grandfather.

node.title: As Vaccine Mandates Move Forward, 1 in 4 Republicans Say They Will Never Get Shot
node.description: Only 2 percent of Democrats said they definitely wouldn't get the vaccine, while 91 percent have already received at least one dose.

node.title: What Polls Say About Support for Stacey Abrams as She Runs for Georgia Governor Again
node.description: Recent polls suggest that the Democratic activist faces a tough campaign.

node.title: The Great Resignation Won’t Last Forever
node.description: The Great Resignation won’t last forever: Americans are waiting for the right opportunity to jump back into the work force.

node.title: Memory, That Unreliable Narrator: New Science Fiction and Fantasy
node.description: Seven books comb through history, travel to distant planets and imagine our A.I. future.

node.title: Best TV Shows of 2021
node.description: From Bo Burnham to “We Are Lady Parts,” the best in television this year offered ingenuity, humor, defiance and hope.

node.title: On Japan’s Pacific Coast, an Artist Communes With Nature
node.description: At his retreat near Isumi, Kazunori Hamana creates humble yet imposing ceramic vessels that evoke the world around him.

node.title: Why Do Christmas Trees Cost More This Year?
node.description: There are fewer tree farms these days, and some were hit by severe weather. Plus, both real and fake trees have been affected by higher shipping costs.

node.title: Why Dave Chappelle's School Made a Sharp U-Turn in Naming Controversy
node.description: The Duke Ellington School of the Arts postponed its decision to name a theater after the comedian amid the controversy surrounding his Netflix special.

node.title: Woman Reveals How She Walks Down Her Dangerous 'Death Stairs' Built in 1890
node.description: The house in Virginia was built in 1775, with the servant stairs added later in 1890.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Some Americans Will Be Eligible for $1,400 Payment in 2022
node.description: Payments will be issued after a person files their taxes in 2021.

node.title: Hiring stalled in November, with economy adding 210,000 jobs
node.description: Job growth fell far short of expectations and represents a sharp slowdown from hiring in October.

node.title: A Christmas party in Norway becomes a possible Omicron-spreading event.
node.description: All those infected were fully vaccinated and tested before entering a restaurant in central Oslo, where one traveler from South Africa carried the new variant.
